Job Title: Inventory Control Specialist - 2nd Shift

Location: High Point, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview

Building our Future Together. FXI is a leading producer of foam innovation in the Bedding, Furniture, Industrial, Home & Office, Healthcare, and Transportation markets. We have made it our mission to provide tailored solutions that delight our customers and consumers. With our corporate headquarters, high-tech research and development facility, and multiple manufacturing locations in North America, FXI has built a culture of innovation and achievement that is recognized by customers, suppliers and peers. Our products include finished goods, sub-assemblies, services, and raw materials for OEMs, fabricators, and retailers. You will find FXI’s foam innovations inside, around, and under yourself in countless applications. Everywhere foam goes, FXI’s innovations lead the way! Won’t you join us?

Position Purpose: Monitors and maintains inventory control of merchandise or materials. This role will is 2nd shift (2:30pm - 10:00pm) and onsite 5-days a week at our High Point, NC plant.

Responsibilities

 Interacts with warehouse and production management as well as lead personnel to accurately direct the movement of raw material to and from production floor and warehouse  Manage and maintain production orders daily  Train new/existing employees on SAP  Uses SAP to maintain inventory records  Audits raw and finished goods inventory  Conducts WIP (Work-In-Process) audits  Work closely with the leads and supervisors to make sure all inventory is properly tagged with appropriate label information and located in the correct warehouse position  Manage control measures to ensure mistakes, inaccuracies and discrepancies are highlighted, addressed, and resolved.  Look into/fix MUV variances  Responsible for month-end and/or quarterly Inventory and monthly cycle counts  Wraps and/or packs, labels and records raw materials for return to warehouse  Follows 5s and Safety policies and procedures  Other duties, as assigned 

Qualifications

 A minimum of 1 year related experience and/or training in all areas of inventory management or equivalent combination of education and experience  SAP experience a plus  Excellent computer skills required  Willingness and ability to work effectively in a team environment  Strong written and verbal communications skills 

Education / Certifications:

 High School Diploma and/ or equivalent 

Qualifications:

 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to work independently and perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.  Ability to communicate effectively including effectively presenting information, comprehending and communicating detailed instructions, reading and writing correspondence and memos, and having knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures as required by the position.  Ability to apply common sense practices to carry out detailed oral or written instruction.  Ability to deal with problems involving multiple variables in continuously changing situations. 

Physical Demands:

 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.  While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.  The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds.  Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.  This position requires the wearing of Personnel Protective Equipment (PPE) consisting of eye protection while on the production floor as well as hearing protection in designated areas. 

Work Environment:

 The environment characteristics describe here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the position.  While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, moving mechanical parts, fumes or airborne particles, regularly exposed to noise levels in the work environment which are moderate to loud, and exposed to temperature ranging from moderate to high depending on the time of year and location of the work being done. 

 Key words

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
